hero.title: We all take childbirth for granted...
hero.description: On March 22, 2020, Annie and Tony checked into the hospital for what should have been a routine delivery of their baby boy. What followed was 24 days that would change their lives forever.
hero.posterAlt: 24 Days Without You movie poster featuring Annie and her baby

screeningsCTA.title: Screenings and Speaking Engagements
screeningsCTA.description: As a case study supporting both AFE and mental-trauma awareness, screening and discussing 24 Days can help foster a culture where trauma-informed care is not just a policy, but a lived practice.

items.quote: This film opened my eyes to the importance of AFE awareness in our medical conferences. A must-see for healthcare professionals.
items.author: Dr. Sarah Chen
items.title: Conference Director

items.quote: 24 Days Without You should be required viewing for all maternity staff. It's a powerful reminder of why we do what we do.
items.author: Nurse Manager Lisa Rodriguez
items.title: Labor & Delivery Unit

items.quote: Our medical students were deeply moved by this documentary. It's now part of our obstetrics curriculum.
items.author: Prof. Michael Thompson
items.title: Medical School
